channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Big Pothole, 27th August
item.description:
Big pothole - getting bigger - makes my car jolt all over the place. Will cause a damage tyre if not fixed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Longleigh Lane, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown horthorn bush on corner, 27th August
item.description:
Resident reporting on the corner o/s No 131 there is a overgrown hawthorn bush with spikes which is dangerous to pedestrians and residents with buggies or mobility scooters, it can actually poke out someone in the face. It is over hanging onto the pavement and risk of people tripping. Please could someone look into this asap
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Halcot Avenue, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Rubbish dumped, 27th August
item.description:
Rubbish dumped by the bus stop. The three bus stops in this road really need public bins. There is always litter by them. The Roads around here don’t get the regular cleaning that they had pre covid. It looks awful it attracts vermin, I’ve seen rats and foxes in these areas. Bring back the regular street cleaners. Even the weeds have been left. Very fed up with it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blithdale Road, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaves and rubbish creating hazard on Ashworth Rd, 27th August
item.description:
The leaves are piling up and will block the drains in the street in front of No 13 to 19 Ashworth Rd. They are also a hazard on the pavement as they become very slippery when it is raining.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Ashworth Road, Maida Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped household items, 27th August
item.description:
Already reported the chair this week and now it’s been joined by more dumped household items. This appeared overnight just proving that if it’s not cleared promptly other rubbish will join it. Beginning to block pavement access.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Manor Way, Abbey Wood, London

item.title: Rotten trees, 27th August
item.description:
Hi No category for this. I’ve reported two trees on the road by our house over the last 2 years. A) one with a bracket fungus (no action) B) a dead tree ( now trimmed) I have also included a picture of rot in the base of a nearby tree. Recently a big tree fell across the road onto a car within a couple of hundred meters of our property. In the light of this I would very much like for these two trees to be removed. The safety of probably thousands of commuters visiting new Beckenham station is at risk not to mention our property. We are really quite scared of any consequences. With thanks Gavin McNaughton 201 Lennard Rd

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kings Hall Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This end of Osbaldeston road seems to be being used as a dump by some residents., 27th August
item.description:
This end of Osbaldeston Road constantly has piles of rubbish left on the street.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Osbaldeston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Spilt paint outside Our house that runs up 50m of teh road and accross the middle White line markers, 27th August
item.description:
We have a video from our ring doorbell showing the back door of a van opening and a paint pot falling out on the 13th August. It has caused a lot of the middle white road dividers to be obscured. There was no attempt by the driver to clear the spillage. Since then there was an Incident (also have video evidence and the police/ fire brigade etc were involved) where a car careered off the road where the largest part of the spill is into my next door neighbours house. As much as it is unsightly I am concerned that it is dangerous. The road is busy and particularly at school times there are a lot of pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 171, Bexley Lane, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet
